FacilityName: Two Rivers Terminal LLC - Moses Lake

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism
_prev_prog_3.Description: Equipment associated with this covered process includes railcars owned by others that are stored on the Facility rail spur.  Trained Facility personnel conduct inspections of the railcars in accordance with the Operating Procedures provided in the PSM/RMPr while the railcars are staged on the Facility rail spur and under the control of the Facility.

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: Failure to maintain water and acid flow to the process; and vehicle strike, vandalism, theft, terrorism
_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Emergency shutoff valve(s) at APP/railcar connection
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installation of backflow check valve in water piping
_prev_prog_3.Description: Equipment associated with this covered process includes the anhydrous ammonia storage tank(s) and/or railcars and associated piping and equipment related to transferring ammonia to a pipe reactor. Trained Facility and/or evaluated Contractor Process Operators transfer the anhydrous ammonia from a railcar, commercial vehicle, and/or the stationary storage tank(s) to a pipe reactor to manufacture ammonium polyphosphate (APP) Fertilizer.

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism
_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Remote activated emergency shutoff valve(s); emergency stop switch for pumps
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Connection of process piping to NH40H BLENDER
_prev_prog_3.Description: Equipment associated with this covered process includes the anhydrous ammonia storage tank(s) and associated piping and equipment related to transferring ammonia.  Trained Facility and/or evaluated Contractor/Vendor Process Operators conduct the transfer of anhydrous ammonia to or from the storage tank(s) to other storage vessels or processes.

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism; loss of SO2 flow or too much ammonia flow
_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Remote activated emergency shutoff valve; emergency stop on ammonia pump
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: EVALUATION OF THE USE OF AQUA AMMONIA IN PROCESS
_prev_prog_3.Description: Equipment associated with this covered process includes the anhydrous ammonia storage tank(s) and associated piping and equipment related to transferring ammonia to absorption towers. Trained TRT Process Operators transfer the anhydrous ammonia from stationary storage tank(s) to absorption towers to manufacture ammonium sulfite and ammonium bisulfite (AS/ABS) fertilizer ingredients.

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism; Incorrect order of fill or too much ammonia flow
_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Remote activated emergency shutoff valve, and emergency stop on ammonia pump
_prev_prog_3.TR_OtherType: WALK THROUGH DEMONSTRATION OF EMERGENCY OPERATION PROCEDURE
_prev_prog_3.Description: Equipment associated with this covered process includes the anhydrous ammonia storage tank(s) and associated piping and equipment related to transferring ammonia to mixing tanks. Trained TRT Process Operators transfer the anhydrous ammonia from stationary storage tank(s) to mixing tanks to manufacture ammonium thiosulfate  (ATS) fertilizer.

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: LOSS OF WATER FLOW TO PROCESS
_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: REMOTE NITROGEN ACTUATED EMERGENCY SHUTOFF VALVE
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: PERSONNEL NH3 DETECTORS AND ALARMS WORN BY OPERATORS
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Ammonia vaporizer which is also used on the ABS process.
_prev_prog_3.Description: This process involves mixing water with anhydrous ammonia to make aqua ammonia (NH4OH).
This process involves storage aqua ammonia and transferring it to commercial tanker trucks.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: This is a non-responding facility and it coordinates its response activities with the LEPC and local Fire Department.  Notification information and procedures are provided in its Contingency Plan.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This Process Safety Management (PSM) and Risk Management Plan (RMP) Program document (PSM/RMPr) was prepared pursuant to the requirements of the Clean Air Act ? 112(r) as codified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) at 29 CFR ? 1910.119 and by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) at 40 CFR ?68.  The OSHA PSM and EPA Subpart D RMP standards are applicable to some operations at this facility.  The Facility engages in either the formulation, distribution and/or the sale of chemicals to customers, most of whom use the products to support agricultural operations (See Section 3.0).  



This electronic submittal provides conservative estimates of the offsite consequences of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident.  The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release (even though a release is unlikely) will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.



PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP



Five year update and new processes planned to be operated at this Facility in the near future.  



FACILITY



The Facility operates agricultural chemical distribution and formulation equipment and sells agriculture chemical products to farms and other agricultural supply companies.  The Facility intends to operate the following covered processes:    



Covered Process 1: Railcar Storage.  Railcars containing anhydrous ammonia are stored on the Facility rail spur for short periods of time without their mode of transport.  The railcars are owned by the anhydrous ammonia vendors or the railroad and are maintained at an off-site location. However, if or when a railcar with anhydrous ammonia is parked on the Facility rail spur, trained Facility Process Operators will be responsible for receiving and inspecting the railcars.  



Covered Process 2: NH3

Storage and Handling.  Anhydrous ammonia is off-loaded from commercial tanker trucks and/or railcars into a stationary storage tank(s).  The transfer operations from tanker trucks to the storage tank(s) are conducted by a commercial truck operator (Contractor/Vendor).  Facility Process Operators manage the anhydrous ammonia once it has been transferred to the storage tank,.  The anhydrous ammonia is then transferred to other processes (e.g. fertilizer blending).  This Facility only conducts blending operations.



Covered Process 3:  APP Reacting.  The Facility will manufacture liquid ammonium polyphosphate (APP) fertilizer using a Pipe Reactor (PR).  The ammonium polyphosphate fertilizer is manufactured by blending anhydrous ammonia with phosphoric acid in the PR.  The resulting ammonium polyphosphate solution is blended with water and discharged to a "wet well" before it is then cooled and transferred to atmospheric storage tanks.  Trained Facility and/or evaluated Contractor Process Operators will operate the process.



Covered Process 4:  ABS Manufacturing.  The Facility will manufacture liquid ammonium bisulfite (ABS) fertilizer ingredients using absorption towers.  The ABS is manufactured by reacting either anhydours or aqueous ammonia with sulfur dioxide gas in an absorption tower.  The sulfur dioxide gas is produced by burning molten sulfur in a furnace.  The resulting ABS fertilizer ingredients are blended with water before it is transferred to atmospheric storage tanks.  Trained Facility Process Operators will operate the process.



Covered Process 5:  ATS Blending.  The Facility will manufacture liquid ammonium thiosulfate (ATS) fertilizer using mixing tanks.  The ATS is manufactured by mixing ABS with molten sulfur.  Anhydrous ammonia is used for pH adjustment.  The resulting ATS fertilizer is then transferred to atmospheric storage tanks.  Trained Facility Process Operators will operate the process.



Covered Process 6:  NH4OH Manufacturing.  The Fa

cility will manufacture ammonium hydroxide solution using a pipe reactor.  NH4OH is manufactured by blending anhydrous ammonia with water.  Trained Facility Process Operators will operate the process.



Covered Process 7:  NH4OH Storage and Handling.  The Facility will store ammonium hydroxide solution and transfer it to process 4 or load it out to commercial tanker trucks.  Trained Facility Process Operators will operate the process.



OFF-SITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS



Worst case and alternative case consequence analyses were completed for each covered processes. The worst case scenario release assumed that all the contents in the largest single storage tank were released.  For covered processes 1, 2, and 3, the largest vessel is a 34,000-gallon railcar of NH3.  For Processes 4, 5, and 6, the largest vessel is a 14000-gallon NH3 storage tank.  These releases were modeled as if the ammonia railcar or tank was punctured on the side at the ground level. The resulting release of ammonia was modeled as a ground level horizontal jet.  The worst case scenario release for Process 7 is failure of a 18,171 gallon storage tank of 24% NH4OH located in the process area tank farm.  Several other aqua ammonia storage scenarios were evaluated in OCA, but this scenario had the greatest distance to toxic endpoint.   





The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario for Covered Process 1 assumes that a vapor valve is not fully closed after a transfer process.  The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario for Covered Processes 2, 3 and 7 assumes a rupture of a transfer hose caused by a pull-away or an impact from a vehicle or some other source during a major loading or unloading operation.  The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario for Covered Processes 4, 5, and 6 assumes the failure of the transfer piping or a braided hose in the transfer piping due to some unknown event.  Although these releases are classified as alternative scenarios, even an accident of the

se types are unlikely to occur due to the safety equipment (excess flow devices, check valves, emergency shutoff valves) and operating procedures that the Facility uses to safeguard ammonia transfer operations.



ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM



The PSM/RMPr Implementation Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Facility.  The Manager is assisted by other Facility staff, as directed.  The Manager is responsible for assuring that Facility Staff are properly trained in the implementation of the Program 3 Accident Prevention Program elements.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



This Facility is a non-responding facility. The Facility has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and/or fire department.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY







CONCLUSION



The Risk Management Plan implemented at this Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Facility adds, deletes, or changes processes. The Emergency Response Program has been coordinated with the LEPC and local fire department.



NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 8 of the standard RMP produced by EPA's RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Facility.
